title: Cornwall League 2
text:
Cornwall League 2 (known as Tribute Cornwall League 2 for sponsorship purposes) is an English level ten <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> league for clubs based in <a href="Cornwall">Cornwall</a>. The champions (and in some seasons the runner-up) are promoted to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a>; there is no relegation. The league ran continuously since 1987–88, except for a two-season break, when Cornwall 2 was combined with Cornwall League 1 for seasons <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Cornwall%20League%201">2009–10</a> and <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Cornwall%20League%201">2010–11</a>. The competition recommenced in <a href="2011%E2%80%9312%20Tribute%20Cornwall%20League%202">2011–12</a> when it was decided to form two leagues of seven teams each. St Agnes are the most successful team having won the league on six occasions.
For the 2016–17 season Cornwall 1 and Cornwall 2 were amalgamated to create the Cornwall League with fifteen teams playing each other once in the first phase. After Christmas the teams split into two leagues with the top eight playing in Cornwall One and the remainder playing in Cornwall Two.
For the 2018–19 season Cornwall League 1 and Cornwall League 2 reverted to separate divisions. Roseland are the current champions, and along with Helston were promoted to Cornwall 1
Current season.
Participating teams and locations.
Stithians, who finished 4th in 2019-20, returned for the current season but withdrew from the league in September 2021, consequently it will run with five teams instead.
2020–21.
Due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20the%20United%20Kingdom">COVID-19 pandemic</a>, the 2020–21 season was cancelled.
2016–17.
For the current season Cornwall 1 and Cornwall 2 have been amalgamated to create the <a href="Cornwall%20League%201%232016%E2%80%9317">Cornwall League</a> with fifteen teams playing each other once in the first phase. After Christmas the teams split into two leagues with the top eight playing in Cornwall One and the remainder playing in Cornwall Two.
2015–16.
The first matches of the 2015–16 Cornwall League 2 were played on 10 October 2015 and the final matches on 2 April 2016 with the six teams playing each of the other teams twice to make ten matches each.
2014–15.
The 2014–15 Cornwall League 2 originally consisted of seven teams; each team playing the others twice, home and away. St Day withdrew before the season started reducing the league to six teams. The season started on 4 October 2014 and finished on 24 January 2015 with the champions, St Agnes promoted to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a>. Lanner, in their first season in league rugby was also promoted after finishing the league season in second place. Both promoted teams finished the league season unbeaten winning eight of their ten matches.
2013–14.
The 2013–14 Cornwall League 2 kicked off on 28 September 2013 and was due to finish on 18 January 2014 with each team playing each of the other teams three times. Owing to fixture cancellations the competition finished on 8 February 2014. The champions, Illogan Park are promoted to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a>, there is no relegation.
Original teams.
When league rugby began in 1987 this division contained the following teams:
Cornwall League 2 honours.
Cornwall League 2 (1987–1993).
The original Cornwall 2 (sponsored by <a href="Courage%20Brewery">Courage</a>) was a tier 10 league with promotion to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a>; there was no relegation.
Cornwall League 2 (1993–1996).
The creation of <a href="Courage%20League%20Division%205">National 5 South</a> for the 1993–94 season meant that the Cornwall League 2 dropped one tier to tier 11. Promotion was to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a> and there was no relegation.
Cornwall League 2 (1996–2009).
The cancellation of <a href="Courage%20League%20Division%205">National 5 South</a> at the end of the 1995–96 season saw Cornwall League 2 return to being a tier 10 division. Promotion continued to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a> and there was no relegation. From the 2008–09 season onwards the league sponsor is <a href="St%20Austell%20Brewery">Tribute</a>. Restructuring at the end of the 2008–09 season saw Cornwall 1 and Cornwall 2 clubs merged into a single Cornwall League.
Cornwall League 2 (2011–2016).
After an absence of several seasons, Cornwall 2 returned due to the splitting of the Cornwall League back into two separate divisions. Remaining at tier 10 of the league system, promotion was once again to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a> and there was no relegation
Cornwall League 2 (2016–2017).
The 2016–17 season saw a restructuring of the Cornwall leagues. For the first half of the season, all clubs from <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a> and Cornwall 2 played in a single tier 9 division. In the second half of the season the league divided into Cornwall 1 and Cornwall 2 leagues based on the league position of the clubs. During this season there was no promotion or relegation to or from Cornwall 2.
Cornwall League 2 (2017–present).
The 2017–18 season saw Cornwall 2 revert to being a tier 10 league. Promotion was to <a href="Cornwall%20League%201">Cornwall 1</a> and there was no relegation.
Geography.
The following clubs have participated in the Cornwall League 2.
Sponsorship.
The competition is known as Cornwall League 2 and has been sponsored by <a href="St%20Austell%20Brewery">St Austell Brewery</a> from season 2011–12 through to the current season, 2015–16; Tribute is the name of a beer. For the first ten seasons (1987–88 to 1996–97) the league was sponsored by the <a href="Courage%20Brewery">Courage Brewery</a>.
